newsitem.title: USA: Carson Pirie Scott sees higher Q1 net.
newsitem.headline: Carson Pirie Scott sees higher Q1 net.

text.p: Carson Pirie Scott & Co said Thursday it expects 1997 first quarter earnings will exceed the prior year's operating earnings per share of $0.15.

"The April sales results brought to a close a satisfying first quarter in which we recorded a nine percent total sales increase and a four percent same-store sales gain," said Stanton Bluestone, chairman and chief executive officer.
"Based on our top-line performance, I expect that our first quarter earnings will exceed the prior year operating earnings per share of $0.15," he said in a statement.
Last year's first quarter operating earnings of $0.15 excluded non-recurring items which totaled $0.43.

Earlier today, the retailer reported comparable store sales for the four weeks ended May 3, 1997 fell 2.2 percent from the comparable period a year ago. Total sales rose 2.4 percent to $85.3 million from $83.3 million last year.

Bluestone said he had expected same-store sales would be flat in the month of April due to a shift in the retailer's promotional calendar. The entire sales decrease occurred in the first week of the month during a major sale event when snow accumulation and extremely cold temperatures reduced customer traffic considerably, he said.
The strongest businesses in the quarter were women's sportswear, shoes, men's better sportswear, furniture, home textiles and luggage.
Comparable store sales rose 2.5 percent for the combined March/April period, which eliminates the effect of the promotional shift and the timing of Easter, the retailer noted.
Carson Pirie Scott operates 52 department stores and four furniture stores.
